text:
India news Mann ki Baat: PM Narendra Modi hails 11th class girl Gayatri for fierce letter over people dirtying Ganga river, calls her an ‘inspiration’ Mann ki Baat: PM Narendra Modi hails 11th class girl Gayatri for fierce letter over people dirtying Ganga river, calls her an ‘inspiration’ In a very moving Mann Ki Baat address to the nation today, PM Narendra Modi today remembered the supreme sacrifice of martyrs. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: March 26, 2017 11:52 AM PM Narendra Modi addressed the 30th edition of his radio broadcast show ‘Mann Ki Baat’ today. (Reuters) 
In a very moving Mann Ki Baat address to the nation today, PM Narendra Modi today remembered the supreme sacrifice of martyrs Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev and Rajguru, and hailed Mahatma Gandhi’s first ‘Gandhian movement’, the Champaran movement and highlighted the fact that this was its 100th anniversary and said that these icons and founding fathers who laid the foundations of for our freedom and as existence as a separate nation, and we can now dream of the creation of a ‘new India’ courtesy the strength, versatility hard work of the people now that can lead to the building of their vision. PM Modi said, “New India manifests the strength and skills of 125 crore Indians, who will create a Bhavya and Divya Bharat.” 
PM also remembered India’s role in bringing freedom to Bangladesh and extended greetings to that nation on its independence day (he remembered that its national anthem was penned by Rabindranath Tagore). While highlighting the role of all these freedom fighters as well as the opportunity their sacrifice has provided to the people o India to build a new, vibrant and prosperous future for themselves, PM Modi also went and highlighted one case – that of a fierce message he received from a young girl who had complained, in a hard-hitting letter about people who are destroying the environment around themselves. Praising her courage and desire to clean the river, PM Modi said that “Gayatri’s message should be a prerna (inspiration) for entire India.” 
Further details awaited.
